security: This document contains personal information, specifically social security numbers, of HSCA staff. Releasing this information could expose these individuals to identity theft or other forms of harm.
summary: Thomas N. Downing, Chairman of the Select Committee on Assassinations, sends a letter to Mr. C. M. Bates, Superintendent of Buildings, requesting access for committee staff to the House Office Building Annex #2 after hours due to delays in issuing House identification cards.
summary_one_paragraph: On December 3, 1976, Thomas N. Downing, Chairman of the Select Committee on Assassinations, wrote to Mr. C. M. Bates, the Superintendent of Buildings, requesting that certain staff members be granted access to the committee rooms in the House Office Building Annex #2 after regular hours. This request was made because these staff members had not yet received their House identification cards through no fault of their own. The letter provides a list of names and social security numbers for verification purposes to allow them entry when no one else is present.
title: Request for Access for HSCA Staff
sender: Thomas N. Downing, Chairman of the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), U.S. House of Representatives
